INT. HALLWAY OUTSIDE RYUJI'S APARTMENT DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP on a TELEVISION SET. There's a baseball game on, but the sound is turned completely down. Camera PANS to show two cute high school girls, MASAMI and TOMOKO. Masam is seated on the floor at a low coffee table, TEXTBOOK in front of her. Tomoko is at her desk. There are SNACKS all over the room, and it's obvious there hasn't been much studying going on. Masami is currently in mid-story, spea excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: They say that some elementary school kid spent the night with his parents at a bed and breakfast in Izu. The kid wanted to go out and play with everybody, right, but he didn't want to miss the program he always used to watch back in Tokyo, so he records it on the VCR in their room. But of course the stations in Izu are different from the ones in Tokyo. In Izu, it was just an empty channel, so he should've recorded nothing but static. But when the kid gets back to his house and watches the tape, all of a sudden this woman comes on the screen and says-- Masami points so suddenly and dramatically at her friend that Tomoko actually jumps in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "One week from now, you will die." Short silence as Masami pauses, relishing the moment.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course the kid's completely freaked, and he stops the video. Just then the phone rings, and when he picks it up a voice says-- Her voice drops voice almost to a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "You watched it, didn't you?" That same time, exactly one week later... he's dead! Masami laughs loudly, thoroughly enjoying her own perform Tomoko, however, is completely silent. She begins looking more and more distressed, until finally Masami notices. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 2.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What is it, Tomoko? Tomoko comes out of her chair and drops onto the floor ne to her friend. Her words are quick, earnest.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: Who did you hear that story from?

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: Who? It's just a rumor. Everybody knows it.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: Youko told you?

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't Youko... Tomoko looks away, worried. Masami slaps her on the knee, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's up with you? Tomoko speaks slowly, still looking away.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: The other day, I... I watched this strange video.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: With Youko and them.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: (excited) So that's what I've been hearing about you doing some double-date/ sleepover thing! So, you and that guy Iwata, huh?

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: No, it's not like that. Nothing happened! Their eyes meet and Tomoko half-blushes, looks away again Her expression becomes serious as she resumes her conversation.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Iwata... he found this weird video. Everyone was like, "What's that?" so he put it on and we all watched it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: (quietly) And? What kind of video was it?

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: Just... weird, I can't really explain it. Anyway, right after we finished watching it, the phone rang. Whoever it was didn't say anything, but still... Silence. Masami curls up on herself, thoroughly spooked.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: It was cuz we'd all heard, you know, the rumors. Tomoko looks seriously over at her friend.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was one week ago today. There is a long, heavy silence as neither of them says anything.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: Waaait a minute. Are you faking me out? Tomoko's face suddenly breaks into a smile.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: Busted, huh? They both crack up laughing.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: Oh, my... I can't believe you! Masami reaches out, slaps her friend on the knee.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're terrible!

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: Gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: (thinking) But hang on... you really stayed the night with Youko and Iwata, right? Tomoko nods, uh-huh. Masami dives forward, pinching her friend's cheeks and grinning wildly. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 4.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, how far did you and he get?

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: Oh... I can't remember.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: You can't remember, huh? Masami laughs, then slaps Tomoko on the knee again as she remembers the trick her friend played on her.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Man, you had me freaked me out. I-- Just at that moment, the phone RINGS. They are both sudde instantly serious. Tomoko's eyes go off in one direction and she begins shaking her head, No. Masami looks over he shoulder, following her friend's gaze. Tomoko is looking at the CLOCK, which currently reads 9:4 The phone continues to ring. Tomoko is now clutching tigh onto her friend, looking panicked.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly) Was it true? Tomoko nods her head, still holding on tightly. Masami ha to forcibly disengage herself in order to stand. The phon is downstairs, so Masami opens the bedroom DOOR and races down the STAIRS. Tomoko calls out to her from behind.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: Masami!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomoko and Masami run down the staircase, through the hal towards the kitchen. Tomoko cries out again just before they reach the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: Masami!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Masami has come to a halt before a PHONE mounted on the w She pauses, looking slowly at her friend, then back to th phone. She takes it tentatively from its cradle, answers wordlessly. The tension continues to mount as nothing is said. Masami suddenly breaks into a huge grin.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: I'll put her on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 5.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Still grinning, she hands the phone to Tomoko. Tomoko snatches it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO
dialogues.text: (softly) es? She is silent for a moment, then smiling widely.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, man! She is so relieved that all the strength seeps out of her and she sinks to the kitchen floor. Masami, equally relie slides down the wall and sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Yeah, I've got a friend over now. Yeah. Yeah, OK. Bye. Tomoko stands to place the phone back in its wall cradle, and then squats back down onto the kitchen floor.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The game's gone into overtime, so they're gonna be a little late. They burst out laughing with relief again, and are soon b clutching their stomachs.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jeeezus, my parents...

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI
dialogues.text: Oh man, I'm tellin' everybody about this tomorrow! Tomoko shakes her head, Don't you dare.

dialogues.speaker: MASAMI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna use your bathroom. Don't go anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: 'K.
dialogues.text: Masami walks out of the kitchen. Alone now, Tomoko stands and walks toward the SINK, where she takes a GLASS from t DISH RACK. She then goes to the FRIDGE and sticks her fac in, looking for something to drink. Suddenly there is the SOUND of people clapping and cheering. Tomoko, startled, peers her head over the refrigerator door to check for th source of the sound. She begins walking slowly, following the sound to the DIN ROOM adjacent the kitchen.  WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are off, and there is no one in the room. Tomo pauses a moment, bathed in the garish LIGHT from the TV, which has been switched on. Playing is the same baseball game they had on the TV upstairs; the same game that Tomo parents are currently at. The VOLUME is up quite high. A puzzled look on her face, Tomoko takes the REMOTE from coffee table and flicks the TV off. She walks back to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOTTLE OF SODA that Tomoko had earlier taken from the f is on the kitchen table. She picks the bottle up, pours herself a drink. Before she can take a sip, however, the air around her becomes suddenly charged, heavy. Her body begins to shiver as somewhere out of sight comes a poppin crackling SOUND underscored by a kind of GROANING. Trembl now, Tomoko spins around to see what she has already felt lurking behind her. She draws in her breath to scream. The screen goes white, and fades into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen is filled with the visage of a nervous-looking YOUNG GIRL. She is being interviewed by ASAKAWA, a female reporter seated offscreen.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There seems to be a popular rumor going around about a "cursed" videotape.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GIRL
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Have you heard what kind of video it might be?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GIRL
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. The girl looks directly at the camera, her mouth dropping into an "0" as she's suddenly overcome by a kind of stage fright. She continues staring, silently, at the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KOMIYA, the cameraman, has lowered his camera. We can now see that the young girl being interviewed is seated at a table between two friends, a SHORT-HAIRED GIRL (GIRL#2) a a LONG-HAIRED GIRL (GIRL #3). They are all dressed in the UNIFORMS of junior high school students. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 7.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Opposite them sits Komiya and Asakawa, a pretty woman in mid-twenties. A BOOM MIKE GUY stands to the left.

dialogues.speaker: KOMIYA
dialogues.text: Uh, don't look right at the camera,

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GIRL
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Let's do it again. Asakawa glances over her shoulder, makes sure that Komiya ready.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you heard what kind of video it might be?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GIRL
dialogues.text: What I heard was, all of a sudden this scaaarry lady comes on the screen and says, "In one week, you will die."

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I heard that if you're watching TV late at night it'll come on, and then your phone'll ring.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Watching TV late at night... do you know what station?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Mmmm... I heard some local station, around Izu.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Izu?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: And, do you know if anyone's really died from watching it? The girl flashes a look at her two friends.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG GIRL
dialogues.text: Well, no one that we know, right? Girl #2 nods her head. Girl #3 nods slowly, opens and clo her mouth as if deciding whether to say something or not. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The reporter notices.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: I heard this from a friend of mine in high school. She said that there was this one girl who watched the video, and then died a week later. She was out on a drive with her boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: They were in a wreck?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: No, their car was parked, but they were both dead inside. Her boyfriend died because he'd watched the video, too. That's what my friend said. Girl #3 grows suddenly defensive.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: It's true! It was in the paper two or three days ago.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Do you know the name of the high school this girl went to?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: No... I heard this from my friend, and it didn't happen at her school. She heard it from a friend at a different school, she sai

dialogues.speaker: INT. NEWS STATION DAY
dialogues.text: Asakawa is seated at her DESK. The station is filled with PEOPLE, scrabbling to meet deadlines. Komiya walks up to Asakawa's desk and holds out a MANILA FOLDER.

dialogues.speaker: KOMIYA
dialogues.text: Mrs. Asakawa?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: KOMIYA
dialogues.text: Here you are.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (taking the folder) Thanks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 9.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Komiya has a seat.

dialogues.speaker: KOMIYA
dialogues.text: This same kind of thing happened about ten years ago too, didn't it? Some popular young singer committed suicide, and then suddenly there was all this talk about her ghost showing up on some music show.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: But I wonder what this rumor's all about. Everyone you ask always mentions "Izu."

dialogues.speaker: KOMIYA
dialogues.text: Maybe that's where it all started. Hey, where was that Kuchi-sake Onna * story from again? * Literally "Ripped-Mouth Lady," a kind of ghastly spectr from Japanese folk stories who wears a veil to hide her m which has been ripped or cut open from ear to ear. She wanders the countryside at night asking men "Do you think beautiful?" then lowering her veil to reveal her true features.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Gifu, but there was some big accident out there, and that ended up being what started the rumor.

dialogues.speaker: KOMIYA
dialogues.text: A big accident?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmm. Something terrible like that is going to stay in people's minds. Sometimes the story of what happened gets twisted around, and ends up coming back as a rumor like this one. That's what they say, at least.

dialogues.speaker: KOMIYA
dialogues.text: D'you think something like that happened out at Izu?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Maybe. Well, anyway, I'm off. See you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: KOMIYA
dialogues.text: See you. Asakawa gets up from her desk and begins walking towards exit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 10.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She takes only a few steps before noticing a RACK of rece DAILY EDITIONS. She takes one from the rack, sets it on a nearby TABLE. S begins flipping the pages, and suddenly spies this story: Strange Automobile Death of Young Couple in Yokohama The bodies of a young man and woman were discovered in their passenger car at around 10 A.M. September 6th. The locati was a vacant lot parallel to Yokohama Prefectural Road. Local authorities identified the deceased as a 19-year ol preparatory school student of Tokyo, and a 16-year old Yokohama resident, a student of a private all-girlsвЂ™ hi school. Because there were no external injuries, police a investigating the possibility of drug-induced suicide... Just then two men walk by, a GUY IN A BUSINESS SUIT and a youngish intern named OKAZAKI. Okazaki is carrying an arm of VIDEOTAPES.

dialogues.speaker: GUY IN SUIT
dialogues.text: OK, Okazaki, I'm counting on you.

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI
dialogues.text: Yessir. The guy in the suit pats Okazaki on the shoulder and walk off. Okazaki turns to walk away, spots Asakawa bent over the s table and peering intently at the newspaper article.

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Miss Asakawa? I thought you were going home early today. Asakawa turns around and begins speaking excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Okazaki, can I ask you a favor?

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI
dialogues.text: Sure. Asakawa points to the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Could you check out this article for me? Get me some more info.?

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI
dialogues.text: I guess...

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Good. Call me as soon as you know more, OK? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 11.

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI
dialogues.text: Ma'am. Asakawa walks off. Okazaki, still carrying the videotapes leans forward to take a look at the article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa drives her car into the lot and parks quickly. Sh gets out, runs up the STAIRCASE to the third floor. She stops in front of a door, sticks her KEY in the lock, and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BOY of about 7 is sitting in an ARMCHAIR facing the ver We can see only the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yoichi! Hearing his name, the boy puts down the BOOK he was readi and stands up, facing the door. He is wearing a white DRE SHIRT with a brown sweater-type VEST over it. He sees Asakawa, his mother, run in the door. She is panting ligh

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. Oh, you've already changed.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: Yup. He points over to his mother's right.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I got your clothes out for you. Asakawa turns to see a DARK SUIT hanging from one of the living room shelves. She reaches out, takes it.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Aargh, we've gotta hurry! She runs into the next room to change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa has changed into all-black FUNERAL ATTIRE. Her ha is up, and she is fastening the clasp to a pearl NECKLACE Yoichi is still in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Did grandpa call?

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nope. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 11 12 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 12.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Yoichi walks into the room and faces his mother.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did Tomo-chan die? * *"_-chan" is a suffix in Japanese that denotes closeness affection. It is most often used for young girls, though can also be used for boys.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Well... it looks like she was really, really sick. She takes a seat on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you do me up? Yoichi fastens the rear button of his mother's dress and zips her up.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: You can die even if you're young?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: If it's something serious... well, yes. Asakawa turns to face her son, puts an arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As hard as it is for us, what your auntie and uncle are going through right now is even harder, so let's not talk about this over there, OK? Yoichi nods.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (remembering) You and her used to play a lot together, didn't you? Yoichi says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RED PAPER LANTERNS mark this place as the site of a wake. Several GIRLS in high school uniforms are standing togeth and talking in groups. Asakawa and Yoichi, walking hand i hand, enter the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are many PEOPLE milling about, speaking softly. A M seated at a counter is taking monetary donations from gue and entering their information into a LEDGER. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12 13 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 13.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Asakawa and Yoichi continue walking, down a hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother and son halt before the open DOOR to the main wake room, where guests may show their respects to the departe The room is laid in traditional Japanese-style tatami*, T GUESTS, their shoes off, are kneeling upon zabuton cushio *A kind of woven straw mat that serves as a carpet. Kneeling opposite the guests is KOUICHI, Asakawa's father The two guests are bowing deeply, and Kouichi bows in response.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Dad. Kouichi turns to see her.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: How is sis holding up?

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: She's resting inside right now. She's shaken up pretty badly, you know. It's best she jus take things easy for a while. Asakawa nods.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: I'll go check on auntie and them, then.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: OK. Ah, Yoichi. Why don't you sit here for a little while? He grabs the young boy and seats him on a cushion next to the two guests. As the guests resume their conversation with Asakawa's father, Yoichi's eyes wander to the ALTAR the front of the room set up to honor the deceased. It is made of wood, and surrounded by candles, flowers, and sma paper lanterns. At the center is a PICTURE of the decease a teenage girl. A small wooden PLAQUE reads her name: Tom Ouishi. It is the same Tomoko from the first scene. Yoichi continues to stare at Tomoko's picture. He makes a peculiar gesture as he does so, rubbing his index finger small circles just between his eyes.  14 15 16 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa walks down the hallway, looking for her aunt. She walks until finding the open doorway to the kitchen. Ther are a few people in there, preparing busily. Asakawa sees her AUNT, who rushes into the hallway to meet her, holds fast by the arm. The aunt speaks in a fierce, quick whisp

dialogues.speaker: AUNT
dialogues.text: Have you heard anything more about Tomo-chan's death?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: No, I...

dialogues.speaker: AUNT
dialogues.text: But the police have already finished their autopsy!

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Well, they said there was no sign of foul play.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) That was no normal death. They haven't once opened the casket to let us see the body. Don't you think that's strange? Asakawa looks away, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoichi has wandered off by himself. He stops at the foot the steps, looking up-- and catches a glimpse of a pair o BARE FEET running up to the second floor. A guarded expression on his face, Yoichi walks slowly up the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoichi has wandered into Tomoko's bedroom. The lights are all off, and there is an eerie feel to it. Yoichi's eyes wander about the room, finally coming to rest on the TELEVISION SET. Suddenly, he hears his mother's voice fro behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKWAWA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yoichi? Yoichi turns to face her as she approaches, puts an arm a him.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: What are you doing up here? You shouldn't just walk into other people's rooms. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 17 18 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 15.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Without replying, Yoichi's gaze slowly returns to the television set. Asakawa holds him by the shoulders, turni him to meet her.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You go on downstairs, OK?

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: He turns to leave, and Asakawa follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Yoichi and Asakawa are about to descend the steps Asakawa's CELL PHONE rings. She opens the clasp to her PU

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (to Yoichi) You go on ahead.

dialogues.speaker: 'K.
dialogues.text: He walks down the steps. Asakawa brings out her cell phon answers it.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI
dialogues.text: Uh... this is Okazaki. I've got some more info on that article for you. The girl was a student of the uh, Seikei School for Women in Yokahama City. Asakawa blinks at this, looks disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (softly) Thanks. She hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa stands now at the entrance of the house. Dazedly, she walks toward a large, hand-painted PLACARD. The placa reads that the wake is being held for a student of the Se School for Women. Asakawa stares at that placard, making the mental connect She turns abruptly, walks towards a nearby TRIO of HIGH S GIRLS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 19 BLUE Revision - 11-4-02 16.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The three Tomoko. Girl Left

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa s row of VI

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Excuse me. This is, um, kind of a strange question, but by any chance were you friends of that young girl that died in the car as well? girls turn their faces to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. If you know anything...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL RIGHT
dialogues.text: They all died the same day. Youko. Even Iwata, he was in a motorcycle accident.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL LEFT
dialogues.text: Because they watched the video.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Video?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL LEFT
dialogues.text: That's what Youko said. They all watched some weird video, and after that their phone rang.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Tomoko-chan watched it, too? Where? shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL LEFT
dialogues.text: She just said they all stayed somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL RIGHT
dialogues.text: There was a girl with Tomoko when she died. She's had to be hospitalized for shock.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL MIDDLE
dialogues.text: They say she won't go anywhere near a television.

dialogues.speaker: STATION
dialogues.text: tands looking up at a SHELF that holds row after DEOTAPES containing news footage. Suddenly from the doorway comes a SHADOW in the shape of an. The s hadow belongs to YOSHINO, a senior reporter.

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO
dialogues.text: Hey. Sorry to keep you waiting. Yoshino walks towards the shelf, scanning its contents. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 19  19 BLUE Revision - 11-4-02 16A.

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's see... Aah, here we are. He reaches out, taking hold of one of the tapes.

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I happened to be out in that area w hen we first got word. The footage n ever made it on the air, though.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Why not? Yoshino pauses a beat.

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO
dialogues.text: You'll understand when you see it. Asakawa and YOSHINO, another news reporter, are watching scenes from the Yokohama car death. In the footage there are lots of POLICEMEN milling about, one of them trying to pick the door to the passenger side Yoshino is giving Asakawa the blow-by-blow. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19  19 20 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 17.

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The bodies of those found were Tsuji Youko, age 17, a student of the Seikei School for Women, and Nomi Takehiko, age 19, preparatory school student. Both their doors were securely locked. Onscreen, the policeman has finally picked the lock. The door opens, and a girl's BODY halffalls out, head facing upwards. Yoshino flicks a BUTTON on the control panel, sc the footage frame by frame. He stops when he gets a good close-up of the victim. Her face is twisted into an insane rictus of fear, mouth open, eyes wide and glassy. Yoshino and Asakawa lean back their seats.

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is the first time I've ever seen something like this.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Cause of death?

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO
dialogues.text: Couldn't say, aside from sudden heart failure.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Drugs?

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO
dialogues.text: The autopsy came up negative. Yoshino takes the video off pause. Onscreen, a policeman has caught the young girl's body from completely falling out, and is pushing it back into the car. As the body mov into an upright position, we can see that the girl's PANT are mid-way around her left thigh.

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These two, about to go at it, suddenly up and die for no apparent reason. He sighs.

dialogues.speaker: YOSHINO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you get it?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: "s CAR is already halted before a modest-sized, two-story HOUSE with a small covered parkway for a garage. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She gets out of her car, closes the door. She stares at the house, unmoving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa stands before her SISTER RYOMI, who is seated at kitchen TABLE. Ryomi is staring blankly away, making no sign of acknowledging her sister. The silence continues unabated, and Asakawa, pensive, wanders idly into the adjoining dining room. She takes a long look at the television, the same televis that had puzzled Tomoko by suddenly switching itself on, sitting darkly in one corner. Her reflection in the scree looks stretched, distorted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tell me that Yoichi came to the funeral, too. Asakawa steps back into the kitchen. She addresses her sister, who continues to stare out at nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Mmm- hmm .

dialogues.speaker: RYOMI
dialogues.text: They used to play a lot together, didn't they? Upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yeah... Ryomi lapses back into a silence. Asakawa waits for her t say more, but when it is clear that nothing else is forthcoming, she quietly gives up and exits the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa climbs the steps to the second floor. She makes h way down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if intruding, Asakawa walks slowly, cautiously into Tomoko's room. The window to the room is open, and a sing piece of folded white PAPER on Tomoko's desk flutters in breeze. Asakawa walks towards it, picks it up. It isa RECEIPT from a photo shop. The developed photos have yet be claimed. Asakawa senses something, spins to look over her shoulder Her sister has crept quietly up the stairs and down the h and stands now in the doorway to Tomoko's room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 23 24 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 19.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She appears not to notice what Asakawa has in her hands, her gaze has already shifted to the sliding closet door. She regards it almost druggedly.

dialogues.speaker: RYOMI
dialogues.text: (haltingly) This... this is where Tomoko died.

dialogues.speaker: RYOMI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tomoko! Ryomi's hands fling aside the CLOSET DOOR. Within, she fi the pale blue CARCASS of her daughter, curled up into an unnatural fetal position. Tomoko's mouth yawns gaping, he eyes glassy and rolled up into the back of her head. Her hands are caught in her hair, as if trying to pull it out the roots. It is a horrific scene; one that says Tomoko died as if from some unspeakable fear.

dialogues.speaker: PRESENT
dialogues.text: Ryomi sinks to her knees, hitting the wooden floor hard. She puts her face into her hands and begins sobbing loudl Asakawa says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa leaves the camera shop clutching Tomoko's unclaim PHOTOS. She walks out onto the sidewalk and begins flippi through them. We see Tomoko standing arm-in-arm with Iwata, her secret boyfriend. Tomoko and her friends eating lunch. The camer had its date-and-time function enabled, and the photos ar marked 97 8 29. The next shot is of Tomoko, Iwata, and another young coup posing in front of a SIGN for a bed and breakfast. The si reads:

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Izu... Asakawa continues looking through the photos, various sho of the four friends clowning around in their room. Sudden she comes to a shot taken the next day, at check out. The friends are lined up, arms linked -- and all four of their faces are blurred, distorted as someone had taken an eraser to them and tried to rub them out of existence.  25 26 27 28 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa wears an APRON, and is frying something up on the STOVE. Yoichi stands watching.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Look, I'm probably going to be late coming home tonight, so just stick your dinner in the microwave when you're ready to eat, OK?

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: "K... Mom?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: Tomo-chan watched some cursed video! Asakawa leaves the food on the stove, runs over to Yoichi and grabs him by the shoulders. She shakes him roughly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: What did you say? You are not to speak of this at school, do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: (utterly unfazed) I won't. I'm going to school now. Yoichi walks off. Asakawa goes back to the stove, but sto after only a few stirs, staring off and thinking. Caption-- "September 13th. Monday.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa drives her car speedily along a narrow country ro LEAVES blowing up in her wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa mutters to herself, deep in thought.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: There's no way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa's car drives past a sign reading: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 28 29 30 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa has left her car and is walking around the drivew of what is less a bed and breakfast and more like a serie of cabin-style rental COTTAGES. She wanders about for a while, trying to get her bearings She pauses now in front of a particular cottage and reach into her PURSE. She withdraws the PICTURE from the photom the one that showed Tomoko and her friends with their fac all blurred. The four are posing in front of their cottag marked in the photograph as "B4." Asakawa lowers the phot to regard the cottage before her.

dialogues.speaker: B4
dialogues.text: She walks to the door, turns the handle experimentally. It's open. Asakawa walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa lets her eyes wander around the cottage. It looks very modern, all wood paneling and spacious comfort. Her eyes rest on the TV/VCR setup at the front of the roo Crouching before the VCR now, she presses the eject butto Nothing happens. She fingers the inside of the deck, find it empty, then reaches behind to the rear of the VCR, searching. Again, there is nothing. Asakawa presses the power button on the television, picks up the REMOTE, and takes a seat on the SOFA. She runs through a few channels but they're all talk shows, no clues whatsoever. She flic the TV off and leans back in the sofa, sighing. Just then, she spies a LEDGER* on the coffee table. *These things are sometimes left in hotels in Japan, so t guests can write a few comments about their stay for othe to read. Asakawa picks the ledger up, begins thumbing through it. She stops at a strange PICTURE obviously drawn by a child that shows three rotund, almost entirely round personages She reads the handwritten MESSAGE.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: My dad is fat. My mom is fat. That's why I'm fat, too. She smiles in spite of herself. Asakawa flips through the rest of the ledger, but there's nothing else of any import. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30 31 32 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 22.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She tosses it back onto the coffee table and, sighing aga leans into the sofa and closes her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa eats silently, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa has returned to the bed and breakfast. As she wal in the door, the COUNTER CLERK rises out of his chair to greet her.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Room for one?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Um, actually I'm here on business. She passes the clerk a picture of Tomoko and her three ot friends. He stares at it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They would have stayed here on August 29th, all four of them. If there's any information you might have...

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Uh, hang on just a minute. The clerk turns his back to her, begins leafing through a guest log.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to himself) August 29th... While she waits, Asakawa's eyes start to wander around th room. Behind the desk is a sign reading "Rental Video," a a large wooden BOOKSHELF filled with VIDEOTAPES. They are all in their original boxes, and she lets her eyes glance over the titles. Raiders of the Lost Ark, 48 Hours----and then, suddenly, she spies a VIDEOTAPE in a plain, unmarke sleeve, tucked away in the back of the very bottom shelf. She feels the hairs on the back of her neck rise.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: That... The clerk looks up.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Hmm? Asakawa stabs a finger excitedly towards the shelf. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 32 33 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 23.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: That! What tape is that? The clerk reaches out for it, grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: This? Hmm... The clerk pulls the tape out of its SLEEVE and checks for label. It's unmarked.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe one of the guests left it behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa flips on the TV. It's on channel 2, and there is nothing but static. She kneels down to slide the tape int the deck and pauses a moment, framed in the vaguely spect LIGHT from the television screen. Steeling her nerves, sh puts the tape into the machine, picks up the remote, and presses play. NOTE: This next scene is entirely visual. If you are read this translation before watching the movie, do yourself a favor; STOP reading this now and watch the scene for itse Afterwards, you can come back here to check the meaning o the Japanese characters displayed.

dialogues.speaker: THE VIDEOTAPE
dialogues.text: At first it looks like nothing has happened-- then Asakaw realizes that she is now viewing recorded static instead broadcast static. She watches, waiting, but the static continues unbroken. Asakawa looks down at the remote, is about to press fast forward, when suddenly the picture on the screen clears a for a moment she thinks she's looking at the moon. It's not the moon at all, she realizes. The shape is roun like a full moon, but it seems to be made up of thin RIBB of cloud streaking against a night sky. And there's a FAC she sees, a face hidden in shadows, looking down from abo What is this? The scene changes now, and Asakawa notes that the tape ha that kind of grainy quality one sees in 3rd or 4th genera copies. The scene is of a WOMAN brushing her long hair before an oval-shaped MIRROR. The nerve-wracking grating as if of some giant metallic insect sounds in the background, but lady doesn't seem to notice. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 24.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The mirror the lady is using to brush her hair suddenly changes position from the left part of the wall before wh she stands, to the right. Almost instantly the mirror returns to its original posit but in that one moment in its changed location we see a s FIGURE in a white GOWN. The woman turns towards where tha figure stood, and smiles. The screen next becomes a twitching, undulating impenetra sea of the kanji characters used in the Japanese language Asakawa can pick out only two things recognizable: Local volcanic eruption Now the screen is awash in PEOPLE-- crawling, scrabbling, shambling masses, some of them moving in reverse. A sound like moaning accompanies them. FIGURE stands upon a shore, its face shrouded. It points accusingly, not towards the screen, but at something unse off to one side. The insect-like screeching sounds louder Close up on inhuman, alien-looking EYE. Inside that eye a single character is reflected in reverse: Chastity. The eye blinks once, twice. The symbol remains. A long shot of an outdoor, uncovered WELL. Sudden loud, blinding STATIC as the tape ends. Asakawa turns the TV off, looking physically drained. She sighs shakily and slumps forward, resting on her knees. Just then, she glances at the television screen. She sees reflected, a small FIGURE in a white gown standing at the rear of the room. Shocked, Asakawa draws in breath, spins around. The room is empty. Asakawa runs to the sofa to collect he jacket -- --and the RINGING of the telephone stops her dead in her tracks. Zombie-like, she walks towards the telephone, pic it up wordlessly. From the other end comes the same metallic, insectoid SQUEAKING heard on the video. Asakawa slams the phone dow and glances up at the CLOCK. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 33 34 35 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 25.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's about seven minutes after 7 P.M.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (to herself) One week... Asakawa grabs her coat, pops the tape out of the deck, an runs out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are off. In the darkness we can see Yoichi cur up in a ball, having fallen asleep waiting for his mother come home. The DOOR opens now, and Asakawa creeps quietly in. She dr to her knees beside her son, face despondent as she regar him intensely. She reaches out and strokes his hair.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa sits, TELEPHONE in hand.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Ryuji? Look... would you meet with me tomorrow? It's important. In the background, the sound of approaching thunder RUMBL menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark and raining heavily. Yoichi, Asakawa's son, is walking to school, UMBRELLA firmly in hand. The sidewalk quite narrow, and Yoichi comes to a halt when a second PE comes from the opposite direction, blocking his way. Yoic slowly raises his umbrella, peers up to look at this othe pedestrian. It is a MAN, a BAG slung over one shoulder. He has a unusual for Japan where clean-shaven is the norm The two continue looking directly at each other, neither moving nor speaking. Yoichi then walks around the person' left and continues on his way. The man resumes walking as well. Caption-- "September 14th. Tuesday.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bearded man, whose name is RYUJI, reaches out to pres the DOORBELL, but the door has already opened from within Asakawa leans out, holding the door open for him. Neither of them speaks. Wordlessly, Ryuji enters the apartment.  36 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji puts his bag down, looks around the apartment. The interior is dark, ominous somehow. He takes his JACKET of and wanders into the living room. Asakawa is in the kitch behind him, preparing TEA. Ryuji spies the framed collect of FRAMED PHOTOGRAPHS in living room.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Yoichi's in elementary school already, is he?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: His first year. What about you, Ryuji? How have you been recently?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Same as always. She takes a seat next to him, serves the tea. On the coffee table before them is a VIDEOTAPE in a plain unmarked case.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: And money is...?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I'm teaching at university. Ryuji picks up his cup of tea but stops, grimacing, befor it is to his lips. He rubs his forehead as if experiencin a sudden headache. Ryuji shakes it off and quickly regain his composure.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anyway. You said that the phone rang?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: So if I watch it too, that phone over there-- He gestures with his mug.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --should ring.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Ryuji, four people have already died. On the same day! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36 37 38 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 27.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (flippant ) Well, why don't you try calling an exorcist? He takes a sip of his tea. Asakawa reaches quickly, grabs something from the bookshelf behind her-- a POLAROID CAME She shoves it into Ryuji's hands, then turns to look down the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Take my picture. Ryuji raises the camera to his eye.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Turn this way.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (unmoving) Hurry up and take it. Ryuji snaps off a shot. It comes out the other end and he takes it, waits impatiently for an image to appear. When does, all he can do is pass it wordlessly over to Asakawa Her face is twisted, misshapen. Just like the picture of Tomoko and her friends. Asakawa stares at it, horrified. By the time she finally looks up, Ryuji has already risen from his seat and slid videotape into the VCR. Again, the screen is filled with static, only to be replaced with what looks like the moon Asakawa slams the Polaroid on the coffee table and goes outside onto the veranda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa stares out at a view of the houses shaded in clou and rain. There is a knock on the glass door behind her. moment later, Ryuji slides the door open.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: It's over. Asakawa re-enters her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Well, it looks like your phone's not ringing. Ryuji pops the tape from the deck, hands it to Asakawa.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Make me a copy of this, will you? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd like to do a little research of my own. There's no reason to write us off as dead just yet. He dramatically takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If there's a video, that means that somebody had to make it.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: There's the guest list from the cottage to look into... and the possibility of someone hacking into the local station's broadcast signals. Asakawa pulls a NOTEPAD from her purse and begins busily scribbling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okazaki putters around. Caption-вЂ” "September 15th. Tuesday."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa sits by herself, reviewing the videotape. She is replaying the very last scene, an outdoor shot of a well. She stares at it carefully, and notices... The tape ends, filling the screen with static. A split-se afterwards, there is a KNOCK on the door and Okazaki ente holding a FILE. Asakawa momentarily forgets about the vid

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI
dialogues.text: (handing her the file) Here's that guest list you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do with this?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Uh... sorry, I'm working on something personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some quick shots of a FOUNTAIN gushing water, PIGEONS fla away looking agitated. CUT to Ryuji sitting on a BENCH. He's deep in thought, writing in a NOTEPAD. There are multitudes of PEOPLE abou (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: him, and we can hear the sounds of their coming and going A PAIR OF LEGS attached to a woman in white dress, hose, pumps appears, heading directly for Ryuji. Her pace is slow, rhythmical, and as that pace progresses all other sounds FADE into the background, so that all we can hear is the CLOMP, CLOMP as those legs walk to stand just before Ryuji. The pumps are scuffed, dirtied with gr A gust of WIND rips by. Ryuji fights the urge to look up in his ears rings the same hollowed, multi-voiced BABBLIN heard on the videotape. The sound grows stronger.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: So, it was you. You did it. The babbling fades, disappears as slowly the world's norm background sounds return. Ryuji looks up, but the woman i white is nowhere to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji rides up on a BICYCLE. He turns the corner towards apartment and finds Asakawa seated on the steps, waiting him.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Hey. Asakawa notes in his face that something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (gruffly) Nothing. He enters the building, carrying his bicycle. Asakawa follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two walk down the hallway towards the FRONT DOOR to Ryuji's apartment. He unlocks the door and they enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji and Asakawa enter the living room.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: So, what'd you come up with?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: I don't think any of the guests on the list brought the tape with them. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 30.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I couldn't confirm it face-to-face of course, but even over the phone I got the feeling they were all being upfront with me.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: How about the other angle? Pirate signals or... Asakawa shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: There're no traces of any illegal television signals being broadcast around Izu. She reaches into her purse, pulls out a large white ENVEL

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here's that copy of the videotape you wanted. Ryuji tears the package open. He squats down on the tatam in front of his TV and slides the tape in. Asakawa sits o the tatami as well, but positions herself away from the T and keeps her eyes averted. Ryuji glares over his shoulde at her.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (sternly) Asakawa. She reluctantly scoots closer, looks up at the screen. Ry fast-forwards the tape a bit, stopping at the scene where the woman is brushing her long hair before an oval mirror He puts the video on frame-by-frame.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen this woman? Asakawa regards the screen intently.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: No... The tape advances to the scene where the mirror suddenly changes positions. When it does, we can again see the sma figure in the white gown, a figure with long black hair. When Ryuji sees this his body stiffens, becomes tense. Asakawa notices but says nothing. She also notices someth else. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 31.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (excitedly) There's something strange about this shot. She takes the remote from Ryuji, rewinds it a ways. On screen, the woman begins coming her long hair again.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: From this angle, the mirror should be reflecting whoever's filming.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: So, what does that mean? Asakawa lets out a short sigh.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Well, if the person who made this is a pro, there'd be a way around that, I guess, but still... The screen changes, showing the mass of squiggling kanji characters again.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (reading) Volcanic eruption... Eruption where? He pauses the screen, trying to make sense of what is wri

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: This is gonna be impossible to figure out on just a regular TV screen, don't you think? They are both still staring at the screen when from behin them comes the SOUND of someone opening the front door. Ryuji turns off the TV, ejects the tape from the deck.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Come on in. Asakawa flashes a look at Ryuji and then turns her head b towards the front door to see who has entered. A cute, nervous-looking young GIRL with short hair approaches slo She is carrying a PLASTIC BAG filled with groceries.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Asakawa, meet my student, Takano Mai. He turns, addresses Mai.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is Asakawa, my ex-wife. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 32.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ryuji gets up and walks conveniently away.

dialogues.speaker: MAI
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you. I'm Takano.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Asakawa. * * As you may already be aware, Japanese name order is the opposite of English's, and even close friends may continu to address one another by their last names. Incidentally, Asakawa's first name is "Reiko." Mai sets the bag of groceries down and chases after Ryuji He is putting on his jacket and getting ready to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MAI
dialogues.text: Sensei, the people from the publishing company called about the deadline on your thesis again. * * In this scene, Mai deferentially refers to Ryuji as sen meaning "teacher."

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (brusquely) What're they talkin' to you about it for?

dialogues.speaker: MAI
dialogues.text: Because they can never get a hold of you. Ryuji picks up his keys, video firmly in hand.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Ask them to wait another week.

dialogues.speaker: MAI
dialogues.text: Sensei, ask them yourself, please. Ryuji is already headed for the door. His back is to her he responds.

dialogues.speaker: OK, OK.
dialogues.text: Asakawa walks after him. They leave. Mai pouts unhappily a bit, and then breaks into a smile a an idea crosses her mind. She walks across the room to wh Ryuji has set up a large BLACKBOARD filled with mathemati equations. Grinning, Mai rubs out part of one equation wi her sleeve and writes in a new value.  45 46 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa and Ryuji stride purposefully. They stop before a DOOR to the right, which Asakawa unlocks. They both walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa and Ryuji sit in a completely darkened room, thei eyes glued to the television MONITOR. They are again watc the scene with the fragmented kanji characters, but despi their efforts have been able to identify only one additio word, bringing the total to three: Volcanic eruption local residents

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: This is impossible. Ryuji fast forwards, stopping at the scene with the kanji reflected inside an alien-looking EYE. He reads it aloud.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sada... * * "Chastity." Ryuji moves to make a note of this, notices the time.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is Yoichi gonna be all right?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (sadly) He's used to it... Short silence. Ryuji breaks it by gesturing towards the screen.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Whoever made this had to have left some kind of clue behind. They're probably waiting for us to find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa turns a DIAL to bring up the volume, which up unt now has been on mute. The room is filled with an eerie, metallic GRATING, and Asakawa spins the dial again, shutt it off. Just as she does, Ryuji's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. He turns the dial again, punches a few buttons as if sear for something. He listens carefully, and when he hears th strange something again he stops, looks at the screen. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46 47 48 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 34.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It is paused at the scene with the figure, pointing, a CL draped over its head. The figure now looks oddly like a messenger. Ryuji and Asakawa exchange glances. This could be it. Ryu flips some more switches, setting the sound for super-slo mo. What follows is a strange, labored sort of speech-- a hidden message-- framed in the skittering distortion of t tape in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: TAPE
dialogues.text: Shoooomonnn bakkkkkarrri toou... boooouuuukonn ga kuuru zouuu...

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (repeating) Shoumon bakkari, boukon ga kuru zo. Did you hear that, too? Asakawa nods. Ryuji is already writing it down excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Ryuji tears the sheet of paper off the notepad, folds it, and tucks it into his shirt pocket.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I'm gonna check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoichi is walking to school. He looks back over his shoul just once, then resumes walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lights are turned off, and she is sitting on the living room couch watching the footage of her cafГ© inter with the junior high school girls. Caption-- "September 16th. Thursday.вЂќ Just when the girl in the interview mentions that whomeve watches the video is supposed to afterwards receive a pho call, Asakawa's own phone RINGS, startling her. She runs answer it.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I've got it. It's a dialect, just like I thought. Shoumon means "playing in the water" and boukon means "monster."* (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 49 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 35.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: *Translated from standard Japanese, the phrase heard on t videotape would sound like, "If only shoumon then the bou will come." These two italicized words, later identified be dialectical, were at the time completely incomprehensi to Ryuji and Asakawa. Dialect can vary dramatically from region to region in Japan, to the point of speakers of different dialect being unable to understand one another. The phrase on the tape can now be rendered, "If you keep playing in the water, the monster will come for you."

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: But, dialect from where?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Oshima. And the site of our "eruption" is Mt. Mihara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji and Asakawa are seated at cubicles, looking through bound ARCHIVES of old newspaper articles. Asakawa sneaks look at Ryuji, stands up and walks off a little ways. She has already pulled out her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (whispering, on phone) Yoichi? I'm gonna be a little late tonight, honey. Ryuji looks over his shoulder at her, scowls.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can do it yourself, right? OK. Sorry. Bye. She hangs up, returns to her seat at the cubicle. She res her scanning of the newspaper articles, and Ryuji shoots another scowl. Asakawa turns a page and then stops, frown She has spied an article that looks like... Nervously, Asakawa puts the thumb and forefinger of each hand together, forming the shape of a rectangle. Or a scr She places the rectangle over the article she has just discovered. Mount Mihara Erupts Local Residents Urged to Take Precaut Ryuji notices her, leans forward excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've got it! This old article... The two scan the remainder of the page, and find a smalle related article. Did Local Girl Predict Eruption? A young lady from Sashikiji prefecture... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49 BLUE Revision - 11-4-02 36.*

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The two read over both articles, absorbing the details. Ryuji stands suddenly, gathering his things.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Has your newspaper got someone out there at Oshima?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: I think so. There should be a correspondent out there.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I need you to find out, and let me know how to get hold of him. Tonight. He begins walking briskly away. Asakawa chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: What do you think you're--?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (angrily) You've only got four days left, Asakawa! Your newspaper contact and I can handle this from here on out. You just stay with Yoichi. Ryuji strides off. Asakawa stands motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa emerges from her CAR, looking tired. She drags he up the stairs to her apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa walks in, immediately assailed by NOISE. Though no one is in the room the TV has been left on, vol up at full blast. Asakawa, frowning, leans over to turn t Tv off. She turns, calling her son's name concernedly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yoichi? Asakawa takes a few steps. She sees Yoichi seated on the floor in the next room, absorbed in play. A multitude of TRUCKS and other small toys cover the floo of the room. Asakawa walks towards her son.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was someone here? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 49  49 50 BLUE Revision - 11-4-02 36A.*

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: (Distractedly) * Nope. * Asakawa leans over, begins picking up some of the toys. *

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: You shouldn't just leave your things * lying all over the place, Yoichi. Have you eaten yet. *

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry. * Asakawa straightens, her face angry. *

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Is it too much to ask that you take * care of things when I'm not around? I don't exactly have alot of free time, in case you haven't noticed. * Yoichi looks up, startled at his mother's anger. Wordless he stands, begins straightening up the room. * Asakawa, her face a mixture of anger and regret, turns he back and makes for the kitchen. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoichi is sound asleep in his futon. Asakawa stands in th doorway, eyes fixed intently on her son. She enters the r and slides into bed next to him, arm around him protectiv She shuts her eyes only briefly, and soon they are again open and staring wide and unblinking into the darkness. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car speeds along. CUT to a gravel DRIVEWAY leading up t a wooden, traditional-style HOUSE. Kouichi, Asakawa's fat is standing before the entrance and puttering around in h GARDEN. The car from the previous shot drives up, comes t a halt. The passenger door opens and Yoichi hops out, run towards the old man. Asakawa walks leisurely after her so

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: Grandpa!

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: Whoa, there! So, you made it, huh? Caption-- "September 17th. Friday.вЂќ (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50 BLUE Revision - 11-4-02

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yoichi says he's looking forward to doing some fishing with you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: Is that so? Yoichi begins tugging excitedly at his grandfather's arm.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: C'mon grandpa, let's go!

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: OK, OK. We'll get our things together and then we can go. EXT. RIVER вЂ” DAY 51 Asakawa stands on a RIVERBANK while her father and Yoichi GUMBOOTS on, are ankle-deep in a shallow river. Yoichi ho a small NET, and Asakawa's dad is pointing and chattering excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: There he is! C'mon, there he is, don't let him go! Yoichi tries to scoop up the fish his grandfather is poin out.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, oh! Ah... guess he got away, huh?

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: That was your fault, grandpa. Asakawa's father laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI
dialogues.text: Well, whaddya say we try again? He begins sloshing noisily out to the center of the strea Yoichi in tow.

dialogues.speaker: KOUICHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll get 'im this time. Asakawa looks away, pensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoichi is passed out asleep on the tatami mats. A TELEVIS looms in one corner of the living room, but it is switche off. The SLIDING DOORS to the adjacent guest room are ope and we can see futons set out, ready for bed. Asakawa enters the living room and, seeing Yoichi, scoops him up in her arms and carries him over to the guest room (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: (sleepily) How was work, mommy? Asakawa tucks him into the futons and walks silently off. INT. KOUICHI'S HOUSE - STAIRCASE вЂ” NIGHT 53 Asakawa stands at the foot of the staircase, telephone RECEIVER in hand. The phone rests on a small STAND by the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah. Your Oshima contact came through. It looks like the woman who predicted the Mihara eruption is the same woman from the video. INT. RYUJI'S APARTMENT вЂ” NIGHT 54 Ryuji is crouched in front of the TV, REMOTE in hand. The screen is paused on the scene of the woman brushing her l hair.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Her name is Yamamura Shizuko. She committed suicide forty years ago by throwing herself into Mt. Mihara.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Have you got anything else?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm gonna have to check it for myself. I'll be leaving for Oshima tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Oshima? I've only got three days left!

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I know. And I've got four. Short silence.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll be in touch. Ryuji hangs up. Asakawa, deep in thought, slowly places t phone back in its CRADLE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55 56 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 39.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She turns around to walk back down the hallway only to fi her father standing there, face full of concern.

dialogues.speaker: KOUJI
dialogues.text: What's happened? Asakawa shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just had some things left over from work. She walks past her father, who glances worriedly after he over his shoulder. INT. KOUJI'S HOUSE - GUEST ROOM вЂ” NIGHT 56 The lights are all off and Asakawa is asleep in her futon Her eyes suddenly fly open as a VOICE sounding eerily lik her deceased niece Tomoko calls out to her.

dialogues.speaker: TOMOKO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Auntie? Asakawa looks around the room, gets her bearings. Her eye fall on the futon next to hers.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yoichi? There is a BODY in that futon, but it is full-grown, dres all in black. It is curled into a fetal position and has its head turned away. Suddenly, the IMAGE from the video of the figure with its face shrouded springs to Asakawa's mind. Just an instant, its pointing visage materializes, and then disappears. It reappears a moment later, pointing more insistently now, disappears again. Asakawa blinks her eyes and realizes that the futon next hers is empty. Yoichi is nowhere to be seen. Just then, she hears that high-pitched, metallic SQUEAKIN from the video. Eyes wide with horror, she flings the sli doors apart-- --and there, seated before the television, is Yoichi. He is watching the video. It is already at the very last scene, the shot of the out well. CLOSEUP on the screen now, and for just an instant we can see that something is trying to claw its way out of the w The video cuts off, and the screen fills with static. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56 57 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 40.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shrieking, Asakawa races over to Yoichi, covers his eyes though it is already too late. She scoots over to the VCR, ejects the tape and stares at uncomprehendingly. She is then at Yoichi's side again, shaking him roughly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yoichi! You brought this with you, didn't you? Why?!?

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI
dialogues.text: Tomo-chan... Asakawa freezes, her eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tomo-chan told me to watch it. EXT. OCEAN вЂ” DAY 57 WAVES are being kicked up by a large PASSENGER SHIP as it speeds on its way. CUT to Asakawa and Ryuji standing on deck, looking out over the waves.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I should've been more careful. When I was at your place that day, I could feel something there. I thought it was just because of the video...

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: You mean that TomokoвЂ”

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: That's not Tomoko. Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yoichi... he can see them too, can't he? Ryuji nods his head, lowers it sadly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's all my fault. First Tomoko died, then those three others. It should have stopped there, but it didn't. Because of me.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I wonder... Asakawa turns to Ryuji suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: How did the rumors about the video even start in the first place? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57 58 59 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 41.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: This kind of thing... it doesn't begin by one person telling a story. It's like everyone's fear takes on a life of its own.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Fear...

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Or maybe it's not fear at all. Maybe it's what we were secretly hoping for all along. EXT. PORT вЂ” DAY 58 The ship has docked, its GANGPLANK extended. Ryuji and Asakawa walk the length of the gangplank towards the shor A man named MR. HAYATSU is already waiting for them. He holds up a white SIGNBOARD in both hands.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Mr. Hayatsu?

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Aah, welcome! You must be tired after your long trip. Please, this way. Mr. Hayatsu leads Asakawa and Ryuji to an awaiting miniva Caption-- "September 18th. Saturday.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji and Asakawa sit in the back. Mr. Hayatsu is behind the wheel, chattering away.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Back in the old days, the Yamamuras used to head fishing boats out in Sashikiji, though they don't much anymore. You know, one of Shizuko's cousins is still alive. He's just an old man now. His son and his daughter- in-law run an old-fashioned inn. I went ahead and booked reservations for y'all, hope that's alright... Asakawa gives the briefest of nods in reply, after which minivan lapses into silence. Asakawa looks dreamily out a the mountain-studded landscape, then suddenly snaps to.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (to Ryuji) Why did Yamamura Shizuko commit suicide? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 60 61 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 42.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: She was taking a real beating in the press, being called a fraud and all sorts of names. After a while she just lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The minivan speeds along a country road. INT. HAYATSU'S MINIVAN вЂ” DAY 61

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Shizuko was getting a lot of attention around the island after predicting the eruption of Mt. Mihara. Seems that for some time she'd had a rather unique ability: precognition. It was around then that she attracted the attention of a certain scholar whom you may have heard of; Ikuma Heihachiro.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: He was driven out of the university, wasn't he? Ryuji nods.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: This Professor Ikuma convinces Shizuko to go to Tokyo with him, where he uses her in a series of demonstrations meant to prove the existence of ESP. At first she's the darling of the press, but the next thing you know they're knocking her down, calling her a fraud. Hmph. Forty years later, the media still hasn't changed that much. Asakawa continues, ignoring Ryuji's barb.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: I've heard this story. But... I'm sure I remember hearing that somebody died at one of those demonstrations. A strange look crosses Ryuji's face. He looks away, ignor her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: After getting kicked out of university, Ikuma just vanished, and no one's been able to get hold of him since. He's probably not even alive anymore. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 61 62 63 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 43.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: But, why even try looking for him?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Because he's supposed to have had a child with Shizuko. A daughter. Asakawa freezes. In her mind, she sees a small FIGURE dre in white, its face hidden by long, black HAIR. It is the figure from the video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Hayatsu leads Asakawa and Ryuji to the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Hello? The INKEEPER, a middle-aged lady named KAZUE wearing a traditional KIMONO, comes shuffling up. She addresses Mr. Hayatsu.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: Thank you. She turns to Asakawa and Ryuji.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be off then. He gives a little bow and is off. Kazue, meanwhile, has produced two pairs of SLIPPERS, which she offers to Ryuji and Asakawa.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: Please. Ryuji and Asakawa begin removing their shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kazue leads Ryuji and Asakawa up a shadowed, wooden STAIR

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: And for your rooms, how shall we...?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Separate, please.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: "Sir.  64 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kazue gives a little bow.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: This way. Kazue turns to the right. Almost immediately after reachi the top of the steps, however, a strange look crosses Ryu face. He heads down the opposite end of the corridor, Asa close behind.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Sir! Ryuji flings open the SLIDING DOOR to one of the older ro There, hanging from one of the walls, is the oval-shaped MIRROR from the video, the one used by the mysterious lad to brush her long hair. Ryuji stares at the mirror, almos wincing. He turns around as if to look at Asakawa, but continues turning, looks past her. Asakawa follows his ga as does Kazue. Standing at the end of the corridor is an old man, MR. YAMAMURA. Yamamura regards them silently, balefully. Breaking the silence, Kazue gestures for Asakawa and Ryuji to follow.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly) Please, this way. Asakawa races past the innkeeper towards the old man. He keeps his back turned towards her.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Please! If you could just answer a few questions, about Shizuko...

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: I got nuthin' to say.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: It's about Shizuko's daughter. The old man says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She did have a daughter, didn't she? Yamamura regards her for a moment, then turns to walk awa

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: You're wasting your time.  65 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TABLE is laid out with an elaborate-looking DINNER. Asakawa sits alone, knees curled up to her chin, eyes wid and frightened. She is whimpering softly to herself. Just then, the DOOR slides open and Ryuji walks in. He sits at the table and picks up a pair of CHOPSTICKS.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Aren't you gonna eat?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Umm...

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Hm?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: You'll stay with me won't you? When it's time for me to die.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Oh, stop it. Asakawa scoots across the tatami mats towards the table, grabs Ryuji fiercely by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: You'll stay, won't you? If you stayed, maybe you'd learn something that could help Yoichi--

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I said stop it! Have you forgotten There was a girl with Tomoko when she died? That girl's now in a mental institution. Who knows what could happen.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: But you could stay with me, Ryuji. You'd be OK.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (angrily) Why, because I'm already not right in the head? Asakawa releases her hold on Ryuji's arm, lowers her head Ryuji slams his chopsticks down angrily.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If that's the case, why not just let things run its course, get rid of father and son? Yoichi was a mistake, anyway. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 46.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Stop it! Short silence. When Ryuji speaks up again, his voice is soft, reassuring.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: We still have two days left... Just then the VOICE of the innkeeper calls tentatively ou from the other side of the sliding door.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Come in. Kazue slides the door open. She stands hesitantly in the doorway, something tucked under one arm.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
