dialogues.text: It's about Miss Shizuko. Ryuji shoots a glance at Asakawa and stands up from the t walks towards the innkeeper.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is all that there is... Kazue produces an old black and white PHOTOGRAPH. The pho shows a WOMAN, seated, dressed in a KIMONO. A MAN ina Western-style SUIT stands beside her.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Is this Professor Ikuma? Hearing this Asakawa leaps up, walks over to examine the picture for herself.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE
dialogues.text: ...yes. This picture is from before I'd entered the household. She pauses a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KAZUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I should go now. The innkeeper scuttles off, leaving Asakawa and Ryuji alo with the photograph. Unbidden, the VOICE from the video enters their thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Shoumon bakkari... boukon ga kuru ZO...  66 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa watches Ryuji stride down the shore. Caption-- "September 19th. Monday.вЂќ Ryuji strolls up to find old man Yamamura sitting alone, staring out at the sea. Yamamura glances up to see Ryuji approaching. Ryuji takes a seat next to the old man, but it's Yamamura who speaks first. The deep basso of his voi emphasizes the drawl of his accent.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: Y'all'd do best to be off soon. Sea's probably gonna be rough tonight.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: What kind of a child was Shizuko?

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: Shizuko was... different. She'd come out here by herself ever'day an' just stare out at the ocean. The fishermen all took a dislikin' to her. Ocean's an unlucky place for us, y'see: every year it swallows up more of our own. You keep starin' out at somethin' like that...

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Shoumon bakkari shite'ru to, boukon ga kuru zo. "If you keep playing in the water, the monster will come for you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yamamura looks at Ryuji, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shizuko could see "inside" people, couldn't she? Down to the places they'd most like to keep hidden. It must have been difficult for her... Yamamura rises unsteadily to his feet, features twisted angrily.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: Please leave! Now! Ryuji stands, takes hold of Yamamura's arm.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I've got a little of that ability myself. It was you who spread the word about Shizuko, wasn't it? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 48.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you who first contacted Professor Ikuma?

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: What're you--?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: You thought you'd be able to make some money off her. You even got some, from one of the newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: Leave me the hell alone! Mr. Yamamura strides angrily off. Both Ryuji and Asakawa take pursuit, Ryuji calling out from behind Yamamura's ba

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Tell us about Shizuko's daughter. Who was she?

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: She was there, with Shizuko. She had to be.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: "s pace, which has become increasingly erratic, finally causes him to stumble and fall. Ryuji comes up behind him, grasping him firmly. At their touch Ryuji's power awakens, and as he peers into the old man's mind there is a sudden blinding

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: The setting is a large MEETING HALL. A number of people a seated in folding chairs before a STAGE, on which are a f MEN in BUSINESS SUITS and a WOMAN in a KIMONO. A BANNER hangs above the stage, which reads PUBLIC DEMONSTRATION O THE EXISTENCE OF CLAIRVOYANCE.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Ryuji eyes widen as he realizes he is seeing Shizuko's demonstration before the press. He also realizes--

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (to Yamamura) You were there! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 49.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: YAMAMURA SHIZUKO, the woman in the kimono, is sitting at TABLE onstage. Her face is calm and expressionless. Stand off to one side and peering from behind the curtains is a young Mr. Yamamura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stood there and watched the demonstration. CUT back to the beach. Asakawa comes running up toward Ry and the prone Mr. Yamamura. Suddenly there is another

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Asakawa, her eyes wide, finds herself inside the scene, reliving it as if she had actually been there. She watche as Shizuko receives a sealed clay POT in both hands. Shiz regards the pot a moment and then places it gently on the table before her. She takes a calligraphy STYLUS from the table, begins writing on a thin, rectangular sheet of RIC PAPER. The members of the press talk excitedly, craning their necks for a better look. Onstage, a JUDGE holds up the phrase written by Shizuko a the folded sheet of paper taken from the sealed pot. The phrase on both sheets is identical.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE
dialogues.text: Match. Cameras begin FLASHING excitedly. Shizuko's features melt into a soft smile. The experiment is performed again, and again the phrase written by Shizuko corresponds to the sealed sheet of pap

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Match. Again and again, Shizuko unerringly demonstrates her powe to "see" the unseen. Finally, a bearded REPORTER explodes from his chair, begins striding angrily towards the stage

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Faker! This is nothing but trickery, and the lowest form of trickery at that. The reporter stops at the foot of the stage, points his f accusingly at Shizuko.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you trying to pull, woman? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 50.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A SECOND REPORTER sitting in the front row also rises to feet.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: That's right! Professor Ikuma, you're being fooled! By now most of the press has risen from their chairs, poi and shouting angrily. Onstage, Shizuko backs away, eyes w and frightened. She covers both ears, trying to block out the increasing din. Professor Ikuma holds her protectivel by the shoulders. The first reporter is still shouting angrily, his voice rising above the others. Suddenly, a pained look crosses his face and he collapses to the floo The crowd, and Asakawa as well, see that the reporter's f is contorted into a grotesque mask of fear.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: He's dead!

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: (to Shizuko) Witch! Professor Ikuma begins leading Shizuko offstage. They sto as someone unseen steps up, blocking their passage. Shizu eyes widen, her head shaking in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: SHIZUKO
dialogues.text: Sadako? Was it you? CUT to Ryuji on the beach. He looks up excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Sadako?! He recalls the image from the video, the alien eye with t single character sada reflected in reverse. * * The majority of girls' names in Japanese end in either ("beauty") or ko ("child"). Thus, Sadako means "Chaste child." Sadako is of course, the mysterious daughter of Shizuko and Professor Ikuma.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sadako killed him? She can kill just with a thought?

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: She's... a devil spawn. CUT back to the demonstration hall. Sadako, her face completely hidden by her long hair, runs offstage... and heads directly for Asakawa. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 66 67 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 51.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Asakawa instinctively raises her arm, and Sadako grasps i fiercely. All the nails on Sadako' hand are stripped away her fingers are raw, bloody stumps. CUT back to the beach. Asakawa, still caught in the throe of the vision, has begun to swoon. Finally her legs give out and she crumples to the beach. Ryuji grabs hold of he supportively. He glances down at her wrist, sees an ugly, purple BRUISE already beginning to form. The bruise is in the shape of five long, spindly fingers. Mr. Yamamura slowly rises to a sitting position, and toge the three watch the approach of ominous, dark STORM CLOUD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa is on the phone, her voice almost frantic.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: That's right. After Yamamura Shizuko committed suicide, Professor Ikuma took the daughter and ran. No, no one knows where they went. That's why I need you to find out where they are. Even if the professor's dead, Sadako should still be in h forties. I'll explain it all later, but right now just hu Asakawa slams the phone down. PAN to show Ryuji slumped i one corner of the room, his back to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Sadako's probably already dead. She could kill people with just a thought, remember? Her mother wasn't even close to that.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (flustered) Well, what about that video? If Sadako's dead then who made it?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Nobody made it. It wasn't made at all. That video... is the pure, physical manifestation of Sadako's hatred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji turns to regard Asakawa, his eyes blank.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've been cursed. There is a moment of silence before Mr. Hayatsu slides th door open, almost falling into the room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67 68 69 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 52.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is out of breath, and speaks rapidly.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: It's no good. With the typhoon coming in, all ships are temporarily staying docked.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: What about the fishing boats? Tell their captains I'll pay.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Fishing boats? Sir, without knowing whether this typhoon is going to hit us or not, I think it'd be better to wait and see how things turn-- Ryuji interrupts him, slamming both palms on the table. Glasses rattle wildly.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Fine! I'll try searching myself! Ryuji stands and races past Mr. Hayatsu out into the rain Hayatsu takes pursuit, calling after him.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: Mr. Takayama!? Mr. Takayama... Asakawa, left alone, stares down at the tatami mats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White-capped waves roll angrily in a black sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa sits at a table, alone, her hands clasped as if i prayer. Her eyes are wide and glassy. The phone RINGS suddenly and Asakawa dives for it, wrenching it from the cradle before it can ring a second time.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Asakawa? I'm sorry. I tried, but I couldn't come up with any leads at all. A look of abject fear crosses Asakawa's face. She begins retreating into herself.

dialogues.speaker: OKAZAKI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69 70 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 53.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (softly) Thank you... Asakawa slowly places the phone back in its cradle. Almos immediately, her face begins to crumple. She falls to her knees, sobbing into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yoichi... She cries a while longer but suddenly stops. Her face, ey streaked with tears, shoots suddenly up, stares directly the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly) Izu...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Asakawa stands looking down on the wharf, scanning. Several FISHING BOATS are docked. The wind whips her hair crazily around. She continues scanning, and suddenly she spies--

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (calling) Ryuji! Asakawa runs down onto the wharf, heading towards Ryuji. is in mid-conversation with Mr. Hayatsu.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ryuji! The phone in my apartment never rang! It only ever rang at the rental cottage! Professor Ikuma must've...

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: And we've got no way of going back.

dialogues.speaker: HAYATSU
dialogues.text: It's too dangerous! The thought of anybody going out in this weather... The three fall into silence as they realize the powerless of their situation. Suddenly, a deep VOICE booms from beh them.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll take you out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 71 72 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 54.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The three spin around to see Mr. Yamamura, his ROBES flap in the gusty night air. He begins walking towards them.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sadako is callin' y'all, reckon. Mayhap to drag you down under the water. Short silence. Ryuji shoots a short questioning glance at Asakawa, turns back to face Mr. Yamamura.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Please. Take us out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny FISHING BOAT is tossed about on the waves. Mr. Yamamura stands at the wheel, his face expressionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji and Asakawa are crouched close together in the cabi Asakawa's expression is dreamy, faraway.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: It's funny. I'm not afraid at all. Ryuji leans over, rubs her hand comfortingly. Suddenly he switches back into analytical mode.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Sadako probably died back out there at Izu, before the rental cottages were ever built.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: So, Sadako was Professor Ikuma's daughter?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (nodding) Ikuma smuggled her out in secret. His relationship with Shizuko was already a scandal, and one of the reasons he got drummed out of the university... We've gotta find Sadako's body.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Is that going to break the curse? Will Yoichi be all right?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: It's all we've got left to try. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Just one more day... Ryuji puts his arm around Asakawa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji stands on deck, looking out over the water. He head down below toward the captain's area. Mr. Yamamura is at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: We made it. Maybe Sadako doesn't have it out for us after all. Long pause as Mr. Yamamura says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA
dialogues.text: Shizuko... she used to speak to the ocean, just ramble away. One time I hid, listenin' to one of her conversations. Mr. Yamamura pauses again.

dialogues.speaker: YAMAMURA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And it weren't in no human language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa has climbed out on deck and is looking up towards the sunrise. Caption-- "September 20th. Monday."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji races out of the store, loaded down with supplies. holds a pair of BUCKETS in one hand and a CROWBAR and SHO in the other. A length of ROPE is coiled over his left shoulder. He runs towards a RENTAL CAR, passing by Asakaw who stands at a PAYPHONE, receiver in hand.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Yoichi? It's mommy. I just called to say I'll be coming home tomorrow. Ryuji shoots a look at her over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm tired of it here, mom! I wanna go back to school. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 56.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (smiling) Yoichi, it's rude to your grandpa to talk like that.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He's laughing. You wanna talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: No, that's... Asakawa pauses, her voice hitching. She seems about to lo her composure.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Yoichi. I'll... I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: YOICHT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What's wrong? Asakawa's face scrunches up in an effort to hold back tea

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Mommy's got something she has to do. Say hello to grandpa for me, OK? Ryuji stands by the car, scowling over at Asakawa. He shu the DOOR just short of a slam. CUT to Asakawa hanging up the phone. She half-runs towards the rental car and enter the passenger side, staring blankly into space. Ryuji sli into the driver's seat, buckles his SEATBELT.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: What time was it when you first watched the video? Asakawa glances at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Seven or eight minutes past seven. PM. No more than ten minutes past.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: If the rumors are true, that time is gonna be our deadline. Asakawa buckles up as Ryuji steps on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa sits in the passenger side. Her face is almost angelic, with the faintest hint of a smile. Ryuji shoots questioning look at her.  77 78 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white rental car tears past the SIGN reading Izu Pacific Land. The car continues into the LOT, screeching around corners before coming to an abrupt halt. Asakawa, her face still oddly expressionless, gets out of the passenger side. Ryu exits as well, the hint of a shudder running through him he regards the series of rental cabins.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT to Asakawa and Ryuji walking up the gravel PATH towar the rental cabins. Ryuji looks back over his shoulder as both he and Asakawa stop before cabin B4. The cabin is on STILTS, its underbelly fenced off by wooden LATICEWORK. Ryuji drops most of his supplies to the ground, but keeps hold of the PICK. He raises the pick over one shoulder and begins smashing away at the latticework. When he has cleared enough space for passage, he begins picking up supplies and tossing th hastily within. When finished, he holds a hand out for Asakawa. The two enter the earthen basement.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER COTTAGE B4
dialogues.text: Ryuji pulls a FLASHLIGHT out, flicks it on. The BEAM arcs outwards, illuminating what looks more like an old mine s than a modern rental cottage. The beam halts when it sudd encounters an old STONE WELL. The well is badly chipped o one side, and sealed off with a solid-looking stone LID. Ryuji rushes quickly towards it.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: I knew it! The well. He squats down beside the well, setting the flashlight on the lid. Asakawa sinks slowly down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: The well... Ryuji reaches out and takes Asakawa's hand. He sets their enclasped hands onto the lid, and together they begin lig tracing the surface of the lid with their free hands. Asa closes her eyes in concentration... and suddenly, as with the incident on the beach, Asakawa finds herself drawn in Ryuji's psychometric VISION.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: The picture is black and white, grainy like old film. A YOUNG GIRL in a WHITE GOWN walks slowly towards an open w (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 58.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She places her hand on the LIP of the well, peers curious down.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: Asakawa looks up, her eyes wide open.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: There is now a second person in the vision, an ELDERLY MA in an old-fashioned tweed SUIT standing behind the young girl. He suddenly produces some BLADED OBJECT, and strikes the girl savagely across the back of the head. The girl falls forward. The man drops to the ground, grab the girl behind the knees and hoisting her limp BODY over the lip and into the well. The body falls into its depths Panting heavily, the man leans forward and grasps the lip the well with both hands, looking down. He flashes a guil look in either direction, checking that his crime has gon unnoticed, and as he does so Asakawa realizes that she kn this face. The image from the videotape, like a face in t moon: it had been Sadako inside the well, looking up to s this man staring back down at her. This man whose name is Professor Ikuma Heihachiro.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Her own father! The energy seems to drain out of Asakawa in a rush, and h body crumbles. Ryuji catches hold of her.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: It was Ikuma who put this lid on. And Sadako's still inside. Ryuji stands quickly, takes hold of the crowbar. He inser it under the lid and begins trying to pry it off, face scrunched with effort. Asakawa digs her fingers in and le her own strength as well. Slowly, the lid begins to move. Ryuji tosses the crowbar aside and the two lean the combi weight of their bodies into it. The lid slides off, dropp to the earth with a dull THUD. Ryuji sits to one side, wi with effort, as Asakawa takes hold of the flashlight. She shines it down into the well, but it only seems to intensify the gloom. What WATER she can see looks fetid a brackish. Ryuji sees her expression and begins removing h JACKET. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 59.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll go. He walks off, leaving Asakawa alone. CUT to an overhead shot of the well. A ROPE is fastened t one side, and Ryuji has already begun lowering himself do His eyes wander over the grime-smeared WALLS, and with a shudder he begins to pick out human FINGERNAILS. Torn loo and spattered with blood, countless fingernails line the sides of the well.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sadako was alive! She'd tried to climb her way out. Ryuji's face twists into a grimace as if momentarily experiencing Sadako's terrible agony. He waits a moment longer before edging his way down the rope again, finally SPLASHING to rest at the bottom of the well. He holds his flashlight above the brackish water, calls up to Asakawa.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lower the buckets! Asakawa nods and lowers two plastic BUCKETS fastened to a rope. Ryuji grabs one and scoops up a bucketful of water, tugging on the rope when finished.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take it up! Asakawa hoists the bucket up to the rim of the well. She walks a small distance and tosses the contents out onto t ground. She happens to glance through the wooden lattice the outside, and with a start realizes that the sun has already started to set. A nervous glance at her WATCH lat and she is back at the well, lowering the empty bucket to find another full one already awaiting her.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take it up! In the well, Ryuji glances at his watch. He looks at it f a long moment, the expression on his face saying We're no going to make it. Time passes as Asakawa pulls up bucketl after bucketload, her strength beginning to fade. She hal stumbles, glances up... and is shocked to realize that NI has fallen. CUT to Asakawa slowly pulling up yet another bucket, her strength almost gone. She looks at her watch and sees tha it is now past 6:00. She calls frantically down to Ryuji.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: It's already six! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 60.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (explosively) I know! Hurry up and TAKE IT UP!! The bucket slowly jerks into motion. Asakawa pulls it up the rim of the well, holds it unsteadily. She takes one faltering step and falls, spilling the bucket's contents onto the ground. CUT to Ryuji in the well, standing ready with another bucketful.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take it up! Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Asakawa! The bucket begins moving, even slower than before. CUT to Asakawa, her body trembling with effort. By now it's all can do to simply keep her body moving. She glances behind her, sees through the wooden lattice that it is now pitch black. A look of resignation crosses her face and she releases her hold on the bucket, her body crumpling and falling in on itself. CUT to the bucket splashing back in the well, narrowly missing Ryuji.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (fuming) What the hell are you doing? Trying to get me killed? CUT back to Asakawa, her face dead. Ryuji calls out from the well.

dialogues.speaker: O.S.
dialogues.text: Hey! ) Asakawa falls backward onto the ground, arms splayed. CUT the rim of the well. Ryuji pulls himself up over the rim, catches sight of Asakawa.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Asakawa! She lifts her head up but says nothing as Ryuji walks ove to her.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll change. You're in no condition to keep this up. Asakawa suddenly springs into life. Her voice is frantic, fearful. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 61.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Who do you expect to pull up these buckets, then?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: But, we don't even know if it's doing any good... Ryuji strides forward and slaps Asakawa painfully across cheek. He begins shaking her roughly for good measure.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: And what about Yoichi, huh? Is his mother not coming to pick him up after all? He releases his hold on her. The two stare at each other long time, saying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa being lowered into the well. CUT now to Asakawa i the well, her face and clothes covered with grime, body simultaneously limp with exhaustion and tense with fright Unable to resist the impulse, Asakawa slowly looks over h shoulder and down into the well. The dankness, the claustrophobia seeps in and she draws in her breath in th first signs of panic.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't look down! She returns her gaze, cranes her neck upward. CUT to Ryuj leaning over the rim of the well, peering down at her. Fo an instant, everything becomes monochrome. It's not Ryuji looking down at her at all; it's Professor Ikuma, checkin to see if she's still alive or if the blow to the back of her head has finished her off. CUT to Asakawa, her eyes wide with fright. Asakawa comes to rest at the bottom of the well. A FLASHL hangs from another rope, but its beam has almost no effec on the darkness. Asakawa crouches forward, hands moving searchingly through the water. She calls out pleadingly.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Where are you? Please, come out. Asakawa straightens, unties herself from the rope. A full bucket already awaits. She tugs on the rope and Ryuji pul it up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 79 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 62.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She scoops up a second bucket, but something stops her fr sending it up. Instead, she begins running her arms throu the water again, her voice close to tears.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please. Where are you? Asakawa continues her blind fumbling, which sends up litt splashes of stagnant water. With a start, she realizes that her fingers have caught something. Seaweed? Asakawa draws her hands close for a better look... and sees that is HAIR. A thick clump of lo black hair. Suddenly a pale, thin ARM shoots out from beneath the wat catching Asakawa just below the wrist. Asakawa's ears are filled with a SOUND like moaning as something slowly rise from its watery slumber. It is a GIRL, her face completely hidden by long, black h CUT to a shot of Asakawa's face. Far from being frightene her features are oddly placid. She regards the fearsome thing before her with an almost tender look. Asakawa reac out, lightly strokes that long hair.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's you... She strokes the hair again, and abruptly it peels right o the head with a loud SQUELCH. Revealed is not a face at all but a SKULL. Its sockets ar at first menacingly empty, but then begin to ooze the gre SLUDGE it has pulled up from the bottom of the well. Like mother comforting a frightened child, Asakawa pulls the skeletal remains to her breast, strokes the bony head comfortingly. Her eyes begin to glaze. CUT to Ryuji racing up to the rim of the well, leaning do intently.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Hey! Asakawa! It's already 10 minutes past seven! We did it! Down in the well, Asakawa continues staring blankly ahead Her body suddenly falls forward, limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three POLICE CARS are parked outside the rental cottages, crimson headlights flashing. A few COPS walk by, two of them carrying something off in white PLASTIC BAGS. CUT to Ryuji and Asakawa sitting on the curb. Asakawa is staring off at something, a BLANKET draped over her shoul (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 80 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 63.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Why would Ikuma have killed her? His own daughter...

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Maybe she wasn't his daughter at all.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Maybe her father... wasn't even human. The two exchange glances. Ryuji's gaze falls to Asakawa's WRIST, which he suddenly takes and holds close to his fac The ugly bruise where Sadako had grabbed her has disappea

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's gone... He shakes his head, clearing his analytical mind of their ordeal.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Enough, already. It's over. C'mon. I'll take you home. Ryuji stands, pulls Asakawa to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji's white CAR pulls up into the parking lot. He and Asakawa get out, regard each other from opposite sides of the car. There is a long moment where neither of them say anything.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: Get some rest. He flashes her the slightest of grins.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I still have a thesis to finish. CUT to a shot of Ryuji and Asakawa, the car creating an a metaphoric distance between them.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: ...thank you. Ryuji nods silently by way of reply. He gets into his car and drives off. Asakawa watches him go, and then walks towards the entrance of her apartment.  81 82 83 84 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa walks into her room, sits on the edge of her bed. It is now morning, and she sits dazedly watching the sun come up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji sits busily scribbling into a NOTEBOOK. He stops writing a moment to regard his notes while taking a sip o COFFEE. He glances over at his BLACKBOARD for confirmatio when a small scowl crosses his brow. It's gone a moment later as he chuckles wryly to himself.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: That girl... Ryuji stands, walks over to the blackboard. He fixes Mai' little prank with a single chalk stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa emerges, taking in the dawn. At first her face is calm and tranquil... but her features change as the sun a noticeably darkens and a WIND begins to kick up her hair. She now looks very anxious. Caption-- "September 21st. Tuesday.вЂќ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryuji is busy scribbling away at his notes again. His han suddenly ceases, eyes dancing worriedly as he hears a fai No. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 BLUE Revision - 11-4-02 65.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then his hand jerks into life, moving with a will of its own. Ryuji watches, shocked, as a series of jagged, s letters forms on the page. H... BE... Lew. Lian When the hand finally ceases writing Ryuji sits a moment stunned silence. He then spins around to face the TELEVIS SET, where the last scene from the videotape-- the shot o the well-- has appeared on screen. Breath rattling fearfully in his throat, he gets out of h seat for a better look, falling to his knees on the tatam The image that fills the screen is the last scene from th videotape; the shot of the well. The SOUND from before comes louder now, more insistent, a metallic screeching that both repulses and beckons him cl Ryuji crawls on all fours towards the SCREEN, stares at i unchanging image with terrible foreboding. There is a flash of MOTION as something shoots out of the well. A hand. First one, and then another, as Sadako, still in her grim white dress, face hidden beneath long, oily strands of ha begins slowly pulling herself out. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 85 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 66.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The television screen jumps unsteadily, fills with static if barely able to contain her image. CUT back and forth between Ryuji, who is beginning to visibly panic, and the television, which shows Sadako lurching ever closer.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI
dialogues.text: (almost frantic) Why?! The TELEPHONE rings, and Ryuji spins round towards it, br catching in his throat. He looks at the phone, over his shoulder at the television, back to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's it! Asakawa... Ryuji scrambles wildly towards the phone. He takes the receiver but is unable to do more than clutch it fearfull as his gaze is drawn inexorably back to the television. Sadako's shrouded face has filled the entire screen... an then, television popping and crackling, she jerks forward and emerges from the television onto the floor of Ryuji's apartment. Ryuji backs away, screaming in terror.

dialogues.speaker: RYUJI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aaargh! Sadako lies prone, collapsed, hair splayed out like a dro corpse. Only her FINGERS are active, crawling, feeling. The TIPS of her fingers are little more than bloodied stu not a single fingernail on them. She uses the strength in those fingers to pull herself forward, coming jerkily to feet. The joints of her body twist unnaturally, more inse like than human. Ryuji flings the phone aside and begins scrambling about apartment as if looking for cover. The strength has alrea begun to fade from his body, however, and his movements a clumsy, exaggerated. He falls to the floor, panting heavi Sadako turns to regard him, and for just an instant we ca see beneath her impenetrable shroud of hair; a single EYE burns with manic, unbridled hatred. Its gaze meets Ryuji's, and his face twists into a grimac as he SCREAMS loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoichi sits on the lawn, doodling into a large SKETCHPAD. He suddenly stops, eyes registering that he has somehow f his father's death.  86 87 88 BLUE Revision - 11-4-02 67.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ASAKAWA'S APARTMENT DAY
dialogues.text: Asakawa clutches the RECEIVER to her ear. She can still hear the sounds of metallic SCREECHING coming from the vi though they are now becoming softer.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. OUTSIDE RYUJI'S APARTMENT BUILDING DAY
dialogues.text: Asakawa comes running down a side street, turning the cor and making for the entrance to Ryuji's apartment building There is a single GUARD posted at the entrance. He reache out, catches Asakawa lightly by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Are you a resident here, ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: I'm Takayama Ryuji's wife! The guard drops his hand, and Asakawa makes for the entra

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: I'm sorry ma'am, but they've already taken the body away. Asakawa's spins around, eyes wide. Body?

dialogues.speaker: INT. HALLWAY OUTSIDE RYUJI'S APARTMENT DAY
dialogues.text: Mai is there, slumped against one wall. Asakawa comes run up, dropping to her knees and grasping Mai by the shoulde

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: What happened? Mai shakes her head dreamily.

dialogues.speaker: MAL
dialogues.text: When I got here he was just lying there...

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: Did he say anything to you? About a videotape? Mai shakes her head again, shakes it harder until the bre catches in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: MAL
dialogues.text: His face... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Mai falls into silence, curls up on herself. Asakawa leav her, begins walking towards the door to Ryuji's apartment when Mai suddenly pipes up from behind.

dialogues.speaker: MAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He never even tried to touch me, you know. Not once. Asakawa turns back around to face her.

dialogues.speaker: MAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He said, it was because he could see inside people's hearts... Asakawa pauses, feeling herself becoming overwhelmed with guilt. With an effort she shakes it off. There is work ye left to do. She heads toward the door to Ryuji's apartmen where a GUARD posted at its entrance has already moved to intercept her.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: (determinedly) ) I'm his wife! She muscles her way past the guard and through the front door to Ryuji's apartment. 88  89 WHITE Revision - 10-30-02 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front DOOR opens wildly, noisily forward. Asakawa com rushing in, eyes darting about the apartment. She thinks frantically to herself.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ryuji... why? Does this mean that Yoichi will die, too? Is the curse not broken yet? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89  89 90 BLUE Revision - 11-4-02 70.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Asakawa's gaze falls to the desk, taking in the stack of looseleaf papers atop its surface. Ryuji's thesis. She suddenly stops dead in her tracks, eyes fixed on one shee in particular. Scribbled on its surface in large, spidery letters is the message: HELL IS REAL She continues to stare at that message, feeling her body ripple with an involuntary shudder. Asakawa turns away. And finds herself face to face with Ryuji's television se The set has been turned off, but its presence hangs heavy ominous somehow. Asakawa suddenly dives forward, pressing the eject button on the VCR. Sure enough, the TAPE is sti in the deck. She takes the tape and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asakawa walks slowly, dreamily forward. She drops the videotape loudly onto the coffee table and slouches into CHAIR. Her eyes fall to the framed photographs of Yoichi one of the shelves. This snaps Asakawa out of her daze an she begins whispering intently to herself, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA
dialogues.text: I was the only one to break Sadako's curse. Ryuji... why...? Something I did that you didn't... Asakawa gives up, lowers her face into her hands. When she looks up again, she happens to glance at the television screen-- and its GLARE reveals that there is someone ELSE in the room with her. It is the figure from the videotape, the silent accuser with the cloth draped o its face. With a start, Asakawa realizes that the figure wearing Ryuji's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ryuji?! She spins around, but the room is empty. Asakawa's mind races. The figure had been pointing towards her BAG. She stands, rummages in her bag to produce her copy of th cursed videotape. She takes Ryuji's COPY in her other han her eyes darting between the two tapes.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Something I did that you didn't... It suddenly clicks home as Asakawa looks full-on at Ryuji version of the tape, plainly marked COPY. (CONTINUED)
BLUE Revision - 11-4-02

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What broke the curse was that I copied the tape and showed it to someone else! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CUT to Asakawa slowly pulling her VCR from the television stand. A look of almost frightening resolve etches her fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARIAL SHOT of Asakawa's car. We hear her VOICE on the cel phone.

dialogues.speaker: ASAKAWA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad? It's me. I'm on my way over. Look, dad, I've got something to ask. It's for Yoichi...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP on the VCR in the passenger side. CUT to Asakawa the wheel as time spirals forward, the decisions of the present already become rumor of the future.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL A, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: They say there's a way you can stay alive after you watch the video. You've gotta make a copy of it, and show it to somebody else inside a week.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL B, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But what about the person you show it to?

dialogues.speaker: GIRL A, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Well, then they make a copy and show it to somebody else. Again, inside a week.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL C, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (laughing) Then there's no end to it.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL A, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That's just it. There is no end. But if it meant not dying... you'd do it, wouldn't you? Asakawa's eyes begin to well. Her car speeds along the highway, to the direction of menacing-looking STORM CLOUD Caption-- "September 22nd. Wednesday.вЂќ FADE TO BLACK as the CAPTION turns blood red.
